reviewText: 7 and a half years ago Warner home video breathed life into this hillariously funny goofy show. Now everywhere I look no season 2 and heare's why that is. Apparently word is that the sales to this one just wasn't high enough for Warner to continue on with the series and that's perfectly understandable. The thing that's not letting me give up on this show is this: When Warner started releasing "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" all was good. Let's skip foward to soon after the 4th season was released back in Auguest of 2006. 2007 came...nothing. 2008 came...nothing. Then came May of 2010. I sat down in front of my computer and went on [...] and and seen a headline for Fresh Prince season 5 being on it's way. It said "Warner has figured it out, crunched the number together and found out a way to make it work"! That got me thinking "Okay so if that happened to that show why can't they do the same thing for The Wayans Brothers"? After the release of the 4th season of Fresh Prince I kept on getting the same answer that I am getting with this one. Sales just dropped. But they figured it out for Fresh Prince. Why can't they do the same thing for this show? Warner if you are reading this please, just think about it. Like I said brfore the 1st season of this show was released 7 and a half years ago. If Warner continues them now you never know what might happen. The sales just might take a turn for the best.

reviewText: I didn't really watch this show when it was new.  I first started watching the reruns on the WB, and it quickly became one of my favorite shows, but then WB took it off the air, so when I saw that this was coming out on DVD I couldn't be happier.  I usually don't buy shows on DVD, unless they don't come on in reruns,  like one of my other favorite shows The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, that show comes on 10X a day.  The Wayans Bros don't come on so I jumped at the chance to buy this and I did not regret it, the whole season if hilarious.  Buy it you will not be disappointed I guarantee.  I am just waiting for the day that Season 2 is released and the rest.
summary: One of the Funniest Shows Ever

reviewText: I grew up watching The Wayans Bros. religiously. Thursday nights was Wayans Night (when Martin went off the air). Years later, it has been taken off of re-runs on the WB and I was left craving to see the Wayans. With the release of the In Living Color series came one of the most anticipated for me, The Wayans Bros. I missed Pops and his classic line "Bang Bang Bang!" and "Yit Tee Tee". Marlon was always the funniest and wackiest of the two. This first season gave me a breath of relief but I am still waiting for the more funnier seasons to be released. The next show I am demanding is Martin!

reviewText: I just finished watching all 13 episodes included in the complete first season of the sitcom "The Wayans Brothers." I used to like this show, I think Marlon is the funniest actor in Hollywood.  Shawn, however, rides the coat tail of his family and their talent.  Notice how Damon, Marlon, Keenen, and Kim have all done projects aside from their work with the family, but Shawn is always in a movie or show with one of his siblings.  That relates to the TV show because Marlon really makes the show funny.  Shawn's best quality is probably his good looks.  On "The Wayans Brothers", Marlon does some crazy things to make you laugh!  I like creativity of the TV show as well as the story line, which is two brothers living together in an urban neighborhood sometimes doing some crazy things to survive.  Marlon annoys Shawn and his girlfriend Lisa throughout the entire first season, but tries to make up for it a couple of times.  Also, they make it seem like Shawn is the "smart" one, which is probably a ploy to make him look better since Marlon is the funny one.  This was a good show and it's a shame it was canceled, but I think it will be funny to most who purchase it.  4 stars

reviewText: THE COMPLETE FIRST SEASON IS DIVIDED INTO 2 DISCS...DISC ONE HAS A PICTURE OF SHAWN WAYANS ON IT ...AND FEATURES THE FUNNIER SHOWS INCLUDED..."GOOP ..HAIR IT IS" FEATURING GARY COLEMAN & WAYAN BROS. DOING A INFORMERCIAL. "I'M TOO SEXY FOR MY BROTHER" FEATURING BEVERLY JOHNSON, SHAWN DOES RUNWAY MODELING..."POPS MOVES IN" FEATURING THE HILARIOUS JOHN WITHERSPOON AS "POPS" AFTER MARLON TELLS POPS TO TELL MOM HE'S THE KING OF HIS CASTLE, MOM KICKS POPS OUT, THUS HE MOVES IN WITH SHAWN & MARLON. THIS DISC CONTAINS 7 OF THE FUNNIER EPISODES.. DISC 2 CONTAINS 6 OVERSILLY EPISODES, THAT ARE SO SILLY ,THEY'RE CORNY "AFRO CAB" AND "BRAZILA VS RODNEY" TO NAME A COUPLE. THE ONLY FUNNY SPOTS ARE PROVIDED BY JOHN WITHERSPOON (POPS). NO BONUS FEATURES, NO DELETED SCENES.

reviewText: The Wayans Bros was never aired in Malaysia (it's a country next to Singapore and Thailand if you didn't know). I'm a big fan of the Wayans bros ever since I saw Scary Movie trilogy and White Chicks (and also a big fan of Damon Wayans).So I decided to buy the DVD after much thoughts... I was scared that I would be wasting my money (and mind you, DVDs cost a bomb to me because of the currency exchange) buying a crappy show that I've never seen or heard before... and boy was I so wrong..This has got to be one of the funniest shows I've ever seen! Each episodes never failed to make me literally rolling on the floor laughing my ass off. Even though sometimes Marlon overdid it with his jokes (with digusting acts) but that's how wacky Marlon is and I love him for that, LOL. The show definitely didn't disappoint me and I'm happy I took the risk of buying the DVD of a show I've never heard before.The only disappointment is that there's no extras in the disc. It'd be awesome if there are some extras with Marlon and Shawn's commentary or something. Can't wait for more release :)

reviewText: What's going on, what, no season two, three, huh?  Where's the rest of the shows at?!  Season one was the weakest link to the chain if you know what I'm sayin'.  Man, I been waiting for Pop's chili for the Pope episode, the I'm your daughter (this chili tastes like sh- MARLON!!) joint, and let me not forget Pop's For Governor.  If you read this review, demand that we got the rest of the show because they left us hangin' with first collection.  We want bonus features, commentaries, more outtakes if any (besides the ones during the credits,) and that would be more than enough for me.  HOLLA IF YA HEAR ME!!!  ONE.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Wayans Bros. was one of those typical 90's sitcoms. Two wacky guys, working at a diner, getting into all sorts of trouble with their hijinks. Nothing really stood out about it.The Wayans brothers themselves are pretty funny, but the writing for this show was nothing more than typical sitcom drivel. They got into wacky situations that were over by the end of the half hour. Don't get me wrong, I did chuckle quietly a couple of times. No laughing out loud, though.If you're looking for something to watch with the Marlon and Shawn Wayans in it, pick up something like White Chicks. Don't even bother renting this one.
